channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What will Trump do next? 13 questions for politics in 2026
item.description: The new year is shaping up to be a consequential one, from control of power in Washington to the agenda President Trump pursues.

item.title: Trump claims U.S. strikes, Maduro captured as explosions hit Caracas
item.description: President Donald Trump claimed overnight that the United States carried out airstrikes in Venezuela and captured President Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Explosions and low-flying aircraft heard in Venezuela's capital Caracas
item.description: At least seven explosions and the sound of low-flying aircraft have been heard in Venezuela's capital, Caracas.

item.title: 'Living a nightmare': Families of teens missing after ski resort fire desperate for news
item.description: Families are appealing for information about children as young as 15 who are thought to have been at the bar.

item.title: U.S. launches military strikes on Venezuela, sources say | Special Report
item.description: President Trump ordered strikes on sites inside Venezuela, including military facilities, U.S. officials told CBS News, as the administration early Sa...

item.title: 1/2: CBS Evening News
item.description: Coast-to-coast storm dumps snow and rain as post-holiday travel begins; A bittersweet update to the goose love story that touched so many

item.title: Coached to Kill
item.description: Did a high school softball coach recruit one of her former players to kill? "48 Hours" correspondent Anne-Marie Green reports.

item.title: Police identify first four victims of Swiss ski resort fire
item.description: Bodies of two Swiss women aged 21 and 16, and two Swiss men aged 18 and 16 have been returned to their families.

item.title: U.S. launches military strikes on Venezuela, Trump says Maduro captured
item.description: Soon after the U.S. carried out military strikes inside Venezuela, President Trump said the nation's President Nicolás Maduro had been captured and fl...

item.title: More than 100 shelter overnight in Japan shrine due to heavy snow
item.description: Visitors of the Mitsumine Shrine spent the night there after roads around it were shut off.

item.title: Two people killed in magnitude 6.5 earthquake in Mexico
item.description: The powerful earthquake shook southern and central Mexico on Friday, also leaving several people injured.

item.title: Trump warning over Iran protests 'reckless' says foreign minister
item.description: The US president earlier said if peaceful protesters are killed, Washington "will come to their rescue".

item.title: Big Tech’s fast-expanding plans for data centers are running into stiff community opposition
Trial to begin for police officer charged in delayed response to Uvalde school shooting

item.title: Yemen's separatists announce a constitution for an independent south
item.description: The move comes as an escalation of a confrontation that has pitted Gulf powerhouses Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates against each other.

item.title: Is Trump taking too much aspirin? Here's what experts say
item.description: Trump takes four times the recommended dose of aspirin for cardiac prevention. Even low-dose aspirin is no longer recommended for people over 60 who d...

item.title: Rain soaks Rose Parade in California and snow squalls hit Midwest and Northeast on first day of 2026
